parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The content focuses on investigative journalism, not on promoting or criticizing any particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and targets a wide audience based on the provided demographic data. The reach is estimated to be between 1K and 5K people.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post falls under the "POLITICAL" category, its objective appears to be investigative journalism, aiming to inform the public about political events and potential wrongdoing. There is no explicit call to vote for or against any candidate. The content itself does not directly advocate for or against any specific political party or candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The description of the advertiser's page and the post's category suggest an investigative journalism approach. The post aims to reveal information and shed light on political issues, which aligns with journalistic practices.  The absence of direct endorsements or calls to action further supports this interpretation.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; instead, it presents itself as investigative journalism.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>561579279918333</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while categorized as "POLITICAL," does not appear to constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on investigative journalism, aiming to inform the public about political issues rather than directly influencing the vote for any specific candidate.  The absence of explicit endorsements, calls to action, or references to specific candidates participating in the parliamentary elections supports this conclusion. The post's objective seems to be to inform, not to sway voters' choices.  While the post is paid for and has a wide reach, this alone does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda. The content itself lacks the key elements of electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Știrea De Azi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
